name: The Ritz-Carlton, Kuala Lumpur

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was definitely an excellent stay as we were greeted by a very pleasant face. Our room was surprisingly upgraded and the room was beyond expectation. It was immaculate, spacious and the bed was the most comfortable bed we've ever slept on!
reviews.title: Excellent stay!

likes.liked: — The bed, bathroom and extra facilities eg. ipod speakers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast in the morning was also excellent. Staff was friendly and efficient and the food, especially the fresh breads were fantastic. These were the icing on the cake!
reviews.title: great place to stay
Want to go back there!
reviews.text: Thank you Ritz Carlton for a fantastic and memorable getaway.
A definite jewel in KL!!
reviews.title: Dream Butler Ashiq

reviews.text: Our experience was great from start to finish. We arrived early but there was no problem booking in. The room was great, very clean, quiet and the bed really comfortable. The staff very friendly and helpful. I'd phoned the concierge earlier and he'd got us our bus tickets to Penang which were waiting for us when we arrived.
reviews.title: Good, but there are better ones in KL

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Ritz Carlton for two nights as a stop over before going on to Thailand. The hotel check in was excellent and they gave us our room at 9am. Our room was on the 14 floor and was actually a suite. We even had our own butler service who were excellent.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.text: Breakfast was lovely and we used the gym and pool and steam and sauna. All lovely again.
reviews.title: My favourite spot in KL
Great Location & Friendly
reviews.text: One of the best hotels we have stayed in for a city break......highly recommended.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I always stay here when I'm in KL on my own. Service has always been good and friendly. I love the breakfast on the first floor and the lounge in the Residences is an oasis after a hectic day outside.
reviews.title: A stylish, luxury hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at the Ritz on xmas eve. The reception was very welcoming and we were upgraded to an executive suite from the club room that we had booked. The room was very spacious, with a living area and seperate toilet, bedroom & dressing area, and large bathroom with separate shower, toilet and bath. All very tastefully decorated although a little bit tired.
reviews.title: Ritz - Just okay in KL

likes.liked: — the large room, comfortable bed and great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A truly good place to stay.
reviews.title: Graceful old lady

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is showing it's age a bit however it was still fantastic with great rooms, brilliant bathrooms and floor to ceiling windows for a great view.
reviews.title: Sensational Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was good but not the best.
reviews.title: Good quality hotel but not a fabulous experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff were great and made you feel welcome.
reviews.title: Truly the best....

likes.liked: — The location and the excellent service...

reviews.text: Do not let the ladies cross the link to the Starhill gallery which must be the most expensive shopping centre I have been in. It even had a branch of the Queens jewellers.
reviews.title: Impeccable service

reviews.text: We originally booked a Premium Junior Suite for 2 adults and 2 kids (3 & 1 yrs old) to stay for 3 nights.
reviews.title: Great Upgrade

reviews.text: Another hotel with wonderful and impressive service. The moment you enter the hotel you felt the warmth of the staff and their eagerness to be of service. The room size is acceptable with comfortable beds. Full range of toiletries and very clean white towels. The room comes with a safe and is placed really low that we have to bend down to set the numbers lock. Thus, is not friendly especially for some folks who has knee problem like mine. The breakfast is highly recommended to us which is nice and tasty, serves freshly squeeze orange juice and not out of a box. You gets to select a choice of hot food (eg: Bacon ad eggs or their local Nasi Lemak fried noodles) from the menu and the rest is buffet spread of bread, salads, cereal & fruits) The price is rather steep (approx. RM60) which for this price I had better breakfast at another nearby hotel. The hotel is link to Starhill Shopping malls and walking distance to major malls. We will return to this hotel for their fabulous service
reviews.title: Impressive Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location and the room was outstanding literarily. The pool is not quite big so we were not encouraged to have a go.
reviews.title: so impressed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have given it 5stars rating because of the staff treatment during our stay, they were really helpful and smile all the time and sometimes we really wondered how they can keep smiling under the pressure they face.
reviews.title: 5 star hotel with 24 hours Butler Service

reviews.text: Special thanks for the the frondesk (I think she was European) who helped us alot during our booking issue.
reviews.title: Nice Location but Tired Hotel

reviews.text: Ritz Carlton Kuala Lumpur-International and Best Brand Ever~
reviews.title: Horrible hotel in Kuala Lumpar

reviews.text: Stayed one night on a short business trip. While the facility itself is older, it's very well maintained if a bit old-fashioned (like most American style hotels). Overall service was excellent and efficient, ironing board turned up in 2min when asked for and lobby staff helped me get blackberry charged without a fuss. Food was good and overall ok priced, the Pavillon shopping mall with more options is walking distance.
reviews.title: Nice hotel with excellent service

reviews.text: We booked the suite with 3 great bedrooms and all the relative facilities, it was just super, wonderful accomodation, central located, and great breakfast....Very nice and friendly butler service. Easy parking facility just under the hotel...surely i reccomend this hotel.
reviews.title: Fantastic experience.

reviews.text: Excellent hotel as one would expect and walking distance to a lot of nice restaurants, shopping and massage places at Bukit Bintang. The room we got was large, comfortable and squeeky clean. Staff were always friendly and helpful, and complementary drinks at the lobby and gym were a nice touch!
reviews.title: Would gladly stay again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I drove into the carpark apprehensively after reading the last review but was not as traumatised. It was narrow, but bright enough to guide a big MPV safely into a lot. The only thing that inconvenienced me was the weak wifi signal in the room, which was too weak to connect to on the second day. Someone mentioned there was a charge to enable wifi in the rooms but I did not confirm it with the hotel.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Was upgraded to an executive suite when we arrived which was very nice. Check in and check out very smooth. Room spotless, loads of room and the bathroom huge with a bath and separate shower room and toilet room within. Service was excellent and lobby staff very friendly. Breakfast was great with a fantastic selection. Pool not very big but very relaxing and nice poolside area. There is a huge shopping centre, which is absolutely stunning joined on to the ritz but unfortunately we could only afford to window shop as it was very expensive designer wear. All in all a wonderful hotel and thoroughly enjoyed my stay, would certainly jump at the chance to stay again.
reviews.title: We had a great stay!!

reviews.text: The best hotel I have ever stayed in! I booked a one night stay as a surprise for my mother and the staff could not do enough to ensure her birthday/mother's day was memorable. We dined in the lounge over afternoon tea which was fantastic value and the birthday cake was nothing short of 5* in quality. The staff here really go for the personal touch and want you to come back-I would stay here again and I only live 10 minutes away!
reviews.title: Amazing hotel with amazing staff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in this Hotel around 5 nights to enjoy the luxury shopping experience offered by Kuala Lumpur and to get our thai student visas in the Thai embassy. We had a Luxury Suite with a butler service.
reviews.title: Very Good Hotel with the best service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The butler (Hakim if i remember his name) was very helpful and dedicated to us. He could help us in many ways such as going to buy cigarets in the middle of the night, bringing us dvd etc...
reviews.title: Amazing Breakfast......

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a very good experience in this hotel which give access to the luxury shopping mall where you can find many brands such as Louis Vuitton, Kenzo, Posrche Design, Dior etc... We just needed to cross a tunnel inside the hotel to access to this mall, very convenient.
reviews.title: Luxury

reviews.text: When we arrived at this hotel we were 1 hr early and they did not have out room ready. They were fairly unaccommodating about this situation and offered for us to wait in the gym/ pool area only after we made a fuss. The room was massive and they were very accommodating making bookings for us for dinner and hair cuts. We were on our honeymoon and the room was set up amazingly when we return from dinner with a rose bath and candles. The breakfast the next morning was exceptional. One of the best in I have had in Asia.
reviews.title: Wonderful service and a fantastic location

reviews.text: I stay at Ritz Carlton Hotels around Asia regularly (Singapore, Jakarta, KL, Shanghai, Bali...), and I have stayed at the Ritz in KL once every few months or so for the past 2 years. I feel compelled to write about my experiences at this hotel, not because they have been exceptionally good or exceptionally bad, but because they have been very, very average for a place that proclaims itself to be a top tier 5 star hotel with butler service for every room.
reviews.title: Not bad, but not the best either

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stress - this is not a bad hotel. It's actually quite a good one - but for anyone expecting more that a very standard 5 star hotel experience, they will be dissappointed.
reviews.title: The best .....I have stayed before

likes.liked: — Everything, especially LI YEN restaurant nand the the SPA Village

reviews.text: The first thing I don't understand is the check-in process. They try to make the experience more private by taking you up to the room to complete the paperwork. This, in theory, sounds great. I could just tell them my name and they whisk me to my room where the paperwork is done. In practice, when you get to the front desk, they ask for your credit card, take an imprint, spend time finding a room -- then they take you upstairs and ask you to wait for the butler to arrive. You wait and wait for the butler who finally arrives and all she asks you to do is fill out your passport number on the form and sign it. Wouldn't it be more efficient to just complete the entire check-in process at the front desk (or, alternatively, get my credit card imprint and do everything upstairs in my room)? Splitting the check-in process between two locations is schizophrenic and inefficient.
reviews.title: Excellent Value- with a few spoliers

likes.disliked: — pool over priced spa and small lobby

reviews.text: While every room comes with a "butler", this is certainly not the exclusive assistant the hotel ads lead you to believe. The ads seem to say that the butlers will go out of their way to meet the needs of guests. However, I found the butlers to be unhelpful even with the most mundane requests. When I asked for ear plugs, I was told by a butler on the phone that he didn't know what they were. After I explained what they were, I was told the hotel didn't have them and he hung up. When I asked my butler if she could help me to replace the feather pillows on my bed because I was allergic, my butler opened the closet door, pointed to two synthetic pillows in the closet and told me I could use those. She said that I could just stick the down pillows on a chair. Then she left.
reviews.title: Our Yardstick - Excellent Service, Unsurpassed Luxury

likes.liked: — spacious, luxurious rooms at affordable rates

reviews.text: Ads for the hotel state that the butler welcomes each guest with juice and fruit. I got a small glass of juice - no fruit.
reviews.title: I like it!

reviews.text: Stayed there for a week as need to attend a course training in the hotel.Room was okay, but I like the big flat screen TV. Personal butler is available 24/7, a personal touch from them is that they delivered a hand written card to you, with their name so that you could call them for assistance.You could order coffee / tea / juices as you like. Housekeeping didn't replenish the shower gel until the last day before I check out, which I think it should not happen as this should be a five star hotel standard. During night time, I could hear some dogs barking outside, as room is facing the street. If you are a light sleeper, you will definetely couldn't sleep. But since I am sharing with my colleague, so I didn't want to trouble him to change room.
reviews.title: Service could be improved

likes.liked: — Personal Butler and Big Flat Screen TV

reviews.text: Breakfast only limited choice available. My colleague was quite annoyed as staff had given him the wrong order for the egg dish 3 days in a row.
reviews.title: Very stylish. Very personal

likes.disliked: — The white carpets, were not that white anymore....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Special thanks to Banquet team as they had made a successful event for us. Concierge team were great , had assist me to make a booking for my air ticket, even collected for me in short time. 2 thumbs up for them.
reviews.title: Fit for a princess

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a suite. Checked in very early at 8 am. No problem. Very convenient location. Very nice room. Nice people. The butlerservice is very personal. The last night our butler Halimah even took care of babysitting our son. Great! She was very friendly, made you feel at home. Breakfast is nice. A lot of complaints over here about the pool. The pool is ok. It is not a large pool for staying several days. It is nice to swim a little, relax a little. Nice place to stay. Staff was very friendly!
reviews.title: Really enjoyed this

reviews.text: We booked this hotel through www.wotif.com for an absolute steal. This is a gorgeous hotel, in a fantstic location.
reviews.title: OK but not great

reviews.text: We Only spent 2 nights here but were treated like royalty! The room was spacious and luxurious. But in KL you don't spend much time in the hotel because you are out sight seeing. So the location in "the golden triangle" is great. It's right next to a luxury mall full of posh shops; over the road from a more mid-priced mall and chain restaurants and about 25 mins walk from the Petronas Towers. There is a stop for the hop on hop off sightseeing bus just a few minutes walk away.
reviews.title: Great base to see KL

reviews.text: The pool area is nice and well kept. The best bit about the hotel was the breakfast. You could have the full English, Indian or Japanese! Toast or noodles. Never seen anything like it in my life!
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: Top tip- go to happy hour in the Sky Bar at the Traders hotel. We went on ladies night and got free margaritas until 8pm!
reviews.title: Pampred!

reviews.text: We stay in a 2 bedroom residence, with our mothers. The space is enourmous. You feel lazy to go outside, just want to relax inside. Butler service is excellent. Definitely will stay there again, no doubt!!!
reviews.title: Great hotel in a great location

reviews.text: We were lucky enough to stay here and we had no regrets. Stylish and luxurious. The spa was a bonus ....sauna, steam room, private tv room.
reviews.title: great hotel

description: The luxurious Ritz-Carlton, Kuala Lumpur features full butler service for all 365 guest rooms and suites. Named "Best Business Hotel" in Malaysia by Business Asia and CNBC, "Best Business Hotel in Kuala Lumpur" by Travel + Leisure, and ranked among the best in the world by Conde Nast Traveler’s Gold List, the hotel re-defines Malaysian 5-star hospitality. Services and facilities include Li Yen, an award-winning Cantonese restaurant, The Lobby Lounge serving international and local favorites, Carlton Gourmet, serving fresh deli specialties, and Cesar's, a luxe-elegant breakfast retreat. With an award-winning tropical "Spa Village" and 24-hour fitness centre, a 30,000 square foot, 3-level wifi-enabled conference center, and a full-service business centre, all connected to the exclusive Starhill Gallery, The Ritz-Carlton Kuala Lumpur is the ideal destination for both business and leisure travelers.
